title: What are the best sources of statistics about historical events? - Quora

response.answer_text: There can’t be a worldwide data source in one book. Mostly we have no good data the further back you go, where much has to be inferred (see “The Better Angels of Our Nature” e.g. for hefty assumptions needed to make conclusions about ancient violence levels). Sociological statistics only starts with London epidemiology and insurance issuance; composing such data for any one location involves a massive amount of research into old archives and the complete application of historical technique. For the US you can go here: Historical Statistics of the United States, Colonial Times to 1970
I googled “International statistical sources for historical events” and saw a page of useful stuff from reputable organizations. A basis for further research.
